Statements and Blocks

Statements and blocks are major syntax components of TJS2.

Statements

A statement is something that ends with a ; (semicolon). Some consist of an expression followed directly by a semicolon, while others are control structures like "if" followed by a semicolon.

Example:
    a++;
    func1();
    return a+b;
    etc.

Blocks

A block is a group of multiple statements enclosed within { }. Statements are executed from top to bottom.

Example:
    {
        a++;
        b++;
    }

    {
        var t=func1();
        func2(t);
        break;
    }

A semicolon (;) is not required after a block.

Additionally, every block creates a scope for variables.

Execution Order

In TJS, statements written outside of functions, classes, and properties are executed as the script is processed. Statements inside functions, classes, and properties are not executed until they are called.

Example:
    var a; // Executed immediately

    function test()
    {
        a+=10; // Not executed until called
    }

    a+=30; // Executed immediately

More accurately, class definitions, function definitions, and property definitions are registered first when the script is executed, and then other script elements are executed from the beginning. Therefore, forward references to functions, classes, and properties are possible within the same script block.

Example:
    test(); // A function declared after this point can still be referenced if it is within the same script block

    function test()
    {
        inform("yah!");
    }

Calling functions across different script blocks is possible as long as the target function has already been loaded at the time the call is made.
Additionally, since variable declarations are processed in the order they are read, forward references for variables are not possible.

Global Object

The global object is a special object that contains variables, functions, properties, etc., declared at the global level (global scope) as its members. It can be accessed using the "global" keyword.
